fr.umlv.wallj.bomb

Class Bomb

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.wallj.bomb.Bomb
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayable

    public class Bomb
extends java.lang.Object
implements Displayable
    Represents a Bomb. After a specific amount of time, a bomb can explode, applying an impulse to all nearby fixtures. It implements Displayable as a Bomb can be drawn in the application window. The timeLeft field is the time before the explosion, and after the start of the physics phase. The body field is the body of the bomb. It represents its position in the JBox2D world, and its coordinates are differents from the Bomb's one. The (x, y) couple of field are the coordinate of the Bomb in the Board. It varies from 0 to the length/width of the board. The exp field is the description of the explosion of the bomb. It contains all the information about the explosion, and is null until the bomb explode
    Author:
    SÃ©verin Gosset - Denis Biguenet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrementTimeLeft()
      Decrease the time left before the explosion of the bomb (min 1s) This method is used during game.refresh() (the placement of the bomb), thus we need to have timeLeft above 1, in order to have a strictly positive time.
      void decrementTimeLeft(double amount)
      Decrease the time left before the explosion of the bomb.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
      Draws the Bomb on the given graphics context.
      void explode()
      Makes the bomb explode, applying all the forces on the moveable situaded inside the radius of the explosion.
      boolean explosionDone()
      Returns if the bomb has already exploded, which means its exp field is not null.
      double getTimeLeft()
      Returns the time left before the explosion of the bomb
      void incrementTimeLeft()
      Increase the time left before the explosion of the bomb (max 99s)
      boolean isExploding()
      Returns if the bomb is exploding, which means the time before the explosion is null.
      static Bomb newBomb(org.jbox2d.dynamics.World world, int x, int y)
      Creates a new Bomb with the given coordinates in the given World.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the bomb

        Parameters:
        world - the world in which the bomb should be created.
        x - the abscissa of the bomb on the board.
        y - the ordinate of the bomb on the board.

      • incrementTimeLeft

        public void incrementTimeLeft()
        Increase the time left before the explosion of the bomb (max 99s)

      • decrementTimeLeft

        public void decrementTimeLeft(double amount)
        Decrease the time left before the explosion of the bomb. This method can be used during game.refresh or during game.physics(), so we dont need to check timeLeft
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of time that must be decreased.

      • decrementTimeLeft

        public void decrementTimeLeft()
        Decrease the time left before the explosion of the bomb (min 1s) This method is used during game.refresh() (the placement of the bomb), thus we need to have timeLeft above 1, in order to have a strictly positive time.

      • isExploding

        public boolean isExploding()
        Returns if the bomb is exploding, which means the time before the explosion is null.
        Returns:
        true if the time is equal to 0, false if not.

      • explosionDone

        public boolean explosionDone()
        Returns if the bomb has already exploded, which means its exp field is not null.
        Returns:
        true if the explosion has been done.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Draws the Bomb on the given graphics context. A bomb is represented by a orange filled circle. If the explosion has been done, it will also be drawn.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Displayable
        Parameters:
